mainTechnologies.Title: Current Technologies
mainTechnologies.description: Here is a list of the technologies that I use most frequently.
tabletop.description: Desktop application that helps game masters maintain real-time combat information, as well as providing a robust NPC creation system.
tabletop.descriptionBoxes.devNotes.title: Developer Notes
tabletop.descriptionBoxes.devNotes.codeT: I created RPV after a lot of frustration as a Dungeon Master using several programs that didn't solve all of my group's problems.
I wanted a tool that would make playing ang preparing more efficient without sacrificing the creative soul of the game.
tabletop.descriptionBoxes.toolsUsed.Reac: Chosen for its flexibility, reusable components, and large ecosystem of libraries that accelerate development.
tabletop.descriptionBoxes.toolsUsed.JSDe: Used to maintain a unified codebase between frontend and backend, simplifying maintenance
tabletop.descriptionBoxes.toolsUsed.Elec: Framework for creating cross-platform desktop applications

Adopted to convert the web application into native desktop software for Windows, Mac and Linux with a single codebase. This extends the reach and provides a more integrated experience to the user system.
tabletop.descriptionBoxes.toolsUsed.Tail: Utility CSS framework for fast, responsive design
Designed to streamline the design process without having to write custom CSS, its utility classes allow you to create consistent, responsive interfaces with less code and greater productivity.
tabletop.descriptionBoxes.toolsUsed.Loca: Storing data in the user's browser

Implemented to store user data locally, reducing the need for server calls and allowing the application to work offline. It is a lightweight and easy-to-implement solution for persisting non-sensitive data.

descriptionBoxes.box1.title: Main Features
descriptionBoxes.box1.text1: Side menu containing player and enemy information, allowing real-time data manipulation
descriptionBoxes.box1.text2: Complete list of D&D system skill checks
descriptionBoxes.box1.text3: Complete list of D&D skills, which change dynamically based on skill selection
descriptionBoxes.box1.text4: Button that allows you to automatically roll all players' initiatives
descriptionBoxes.box2.title: Character Creator
descriptionBoxes.box2.text1: Static Data: Robust database with character statistics from various models
descriptionBoxes.box2.text2: Organic Data: Character creator that allows you to create unique characteristics for characters at the press of a button, including: Behavioral Traits, Profession or Occupation, one unique characteristic and possible involvement with crime
